text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am prashop a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Bangalore India today I am going to show
you how to install WordPress in an
Amazon light cell instance instead of
using Wordpress blueprint provided by
bitnami let's get started
after logging into the AWS Management
console navigate to the light sale
console
in the light save console launch a lamp
instance
you can see that the instance launch is
successful and is in the available state
choose the connect button to connect to
the instance
we need the MySQL root password
to get this use the following command
copy the password
now run the command to enter MySQL shell
using the password you obtained earlier
create a database and user with a
password and then add privileges to the
new database
make sure to replace database name with
the name of database that you want to
create WordPress user with the name of
the user for WordPress and password with
the desired password
now that our database is created let's
move to the next step to install and
configure WordPress
run the commands to download the latest
version of Wordpress
extract a package using tar command
move the WordPress files to the document
root
change the directory to document root
then create the WordPress configuration
file
wpconfig.psp by renaming the file WP
config sample.php
edit the WordPress configuration file in
the VA editor
replace database name WordPress user and
password with the credentials created
earlier
save the file press Escape type colon W
Cube exclamation and then press enter
we name the default index.html file
present in the document root
the WordPress installation is completed
now access the website using IP address
and complete the initial setup open the
browser and access the IP address you
will see the WordPress initial setup
page so now you know how to install the
WordPress in a light cell instance
instead of using the WordPress blueprint
provided by bitnami
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
foreign
[Music]
